title: About
text:
The articles are intended to be fairly basic treatments of various concepts that involve the use of computer programming in physics. They arenâ€™t necessarily comprehensive or self-contained but Iâ€™ll try to cite more detailed sources as much as possible. Topics can range from simple mathematical concepts like algebra and probability illustrated using code to pretty advanced ones like quantum computation and machine learning algorithms- not in any particular order.
Weâ€™ll primarily use the Julia programming language for coding, in the form of Pluto notebooks. Julia has important advantages like speed, simplicity, great community, emojis ðŸ˜‰ and Greek Î±-bet, to best deal with physics. Pluto notebooks offer reproducibility, reactiveness and widgets! Python and Jupyter notebooks may be used occassionally if it seems reasonable. The top priority will be for the articles to look more physics-y and less code-y.
Me? Iâ€™m a researcher studying and working on computational physics algorithms- and this is a fun side-project, for now. Please feel free to reach out for comments, love and criticismâ€¦
